intro: Mesochlaena sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran mesochlaena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Indonesian islands of Sumatra and Java. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Mesochlaena sumatrensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
